hr.fer.zemris.java.graphics.raster

Interface BWRaster

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BWRasterMem

    public interface BWRaster
    Provides a procedure for drawing on raster devices Letters BW stand for Black-and-White raster. The coordinate system for raster has (0,0) at the top-left corner of raster; positive x-axis is to the right and positive y-axis is toward the bottom.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Stjepan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeFlip()
      If flip is enabled this method will disable it .
      void clear()
      Turns off all pixels in raster.
      void disableFlipMode()
      Controls the flipping mode which is initially disabled.

      Controls the flipping mode which is initially disabled.
      int getHeight()
      Returns appropriate dimension(height) of used raster.
      int getWidth()
      Returns appropriate dimension(width) of used raster.

      Checks if the pixel at the given location is turned on and if it is, returns true, otherwise returns false.

      Turns pixel off at the specified location.
      void turnOn(int x, int y)
      Turns pixel on at the specified location.

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns appropriate dimension(width) of used raster.
        Returns:
        dimension width

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns appropriate dimension(height) of used raster.
        Returns:
        dimension height

      • clear

        void clear()
        Turns off all pixels in raster.

      • turnOn

        void turnOn(int x,
            int y)
        Turns pixel on at the specified location. The working of turnOn method is closely controlled with flipping mode of raster. If flipping mode of raster is disabled, then the call of the turnOn method turns on the pixel at specified location (again, if location is valid). However, if flipping mode is enabled, then the call of the turnOn method flips the pixel at the specified location (if it was turned on, it will be turned off, and if it was turned off, it will be turned on).
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if (x,y) is invalid with respect to raster dimensions
        See Also:
        for information about coordinate system

      • turnOff

        void turnOff(int x,
             int y)
        Turns pixel off at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if (x,y) is invalid with respect to raster dimensions
        See Also:
        for information about coordinate system

      • enableFlipMode

        void enableFlipMode()
        Controls the flipping mode which is initially disabled.
        See Also:
        turnOn(int, int)

      • disableFlipMode

        void disableFlipMode()
        Controls the flipping mode which is initially disabled.
        See Also:
        turnOn(int, int)

      • isTurnedOn

        boolean isTurnedOn(int x,
                   int y)
        Checks if the pixel at the given location is turned on and if it is, returns true, otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if pixel on (x, y) is turned on, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if coordinate is not in rasters range

      • changeFlip

        void changeFlip()
        If flip is enabled this method will disable it . If flip is disabled this method will enable it .
